qas.question: Which four classes made up the ancient -Chamorro society?

answers.text: chamorri (chiefs), matua (upper class), achaot (middle class), and mana'chang (lower class)

qas.question: Where were the matua located on the island?
What did the mana'chang have the best access to?
What did the matua have the best access to?
Who did the makahna mostly heal with medicine?

context: The ancient-Chamorro society had four classes: <a0_0>chamorri (chiefs), matua (upper class), achaot (middle class), and <b7_0>mana'chang<b7_0/> (lower class)<a0_0/>.:20–21 The matua were located in the <a1_0><b4_0>coastal villages<b4_0/><a1_0/>, which meant they had the best access to <b5_0><b6_0>fishing grounds<b6_0/><b5_0/>, whereas the mana'chang were located in the <a2_0><b3_0>interior of the island<b3_0/><a2_0/>. Matua and mana'chang rarely communicated with each other, and matua often used achaot as intermediaries. There were also "makåhna" (similar to shamans), skilled in healing and medicine. Belief in spirits of ancient Chamorros called "Taotao mo'na" still persists as a remnant of pre-European culture. Their society was organized along matrilineal clans.:21
